title: Eva Longoria shows off her toned figure in form-fitting black top
text:
She made waves at Paris Fashion Week last week alongside her son Santiago.

And Eva Longoria got some quality time off mommy duty as she stepped out to get her nails done in the Beverly Hills neighborhood of Los Angeles on Tuesday.

The Desperate Housewives vet, 44, kept casual in a black long-sleeved tee that hugged her curves as well as a pair of skintight leggings.

Casual: Eva Longoria got some quality time off mommy duty as she stepped out to get her nails done in the Beverly Hills neighborhood of Los Angeles on Tuesday

She had a quilted Chanel fanny pack slung across her waist and kept her brunette locks bundled beneath a black baseball cap.

Eva's feet hit the pavement in a pair of stark white chunky sneakers.

The 5ft 2in beauty accessorized further with a gold pendant necklace.

Adorable: Eva hit the catwalk on Saturday, Sept. 28 at the L'Oréal Paris Le Défilé show during Paris Fashion Week. Also in tow was her 15-month-old son Santiago Enrique Bastón, whom she carried out during the finale of the runway show

Eva hit the catwalk on Saturday, Sept. 28 at the L'Oréal Paris Le Défilé show during Paris Fashion Week.

She did so alongside fellow actresses Iskra Lawrence, Aja Naomi King, Amber Heard, Helen Mirren, and Camila Cabello.

Also in tow was her 15-month-old son Santiago Enrique Bastón, whom she carried out during the finale of the runway show.

Sweet: Eva and her husband José Antonio Bastón welcomed Santiago into the world last June

Eva and her husband José Antonio Bastón welcomed Santiago into the world last June.

And in her words, his arrival couldn't have come at a better time now that she's 43.

'He was meant to be with me at this stage in my life,' she told Parents Latina magazine in August. 'I’m more patient, and I don’t work as much - even though it doesn’t seem that way!'

Eva and José have been married since 2016.

She was previously wed to NBA star Tony Parker from 2007-2011, and actor Tyler Christopher from 2002-2004.
